Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Reverend Dr. Floyd H. Flake, The Greater Allen A.M.E. Cathedral of New York, 110-31 Merrick Blvd, Jamaica, NY 11433.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Comrie.
Items.MinutesNote: The Invocation was delivered by: Reverend Dr. Floyd H. Flake, The Greater Allen A.M.E. Cathedral of New York, 110-31 Merrick Blvd, Jamaica, N.Y. 11433.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of July 29, 2010 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gentile.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gentile moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of July 29, 2010 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups
Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution calling on the Delaware River Basin Commission to refrain from issuing regulations governing gas exploration and production using hydraulic fracturing and for water withdrawal for the purpose of hydraulic fracturing within the Delaware River Basin until a cumulative impact study is completed to assess the risks and inform the development of adequate regulations for hydraulic fracturing in the Delaware River Basin.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.
Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Delaware River Basin Commission to refrain from issuing regulations governing gas exploration and production using hydraulic fracturing and for water withdrawal for the purpose of hydraulic fracturing within the Delaware River Basin.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2011 and Fiscal 2010 Expense Budgets.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2011 and Fiscal 2010 Expense Budgets.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing unnecessary artificial lighting in lobbies and hallways.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reducing unnecessary artificial lighting in lobbies and hallways.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to energy efficiency in commercial buildings.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Energy efficiency in commercial buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to including environmental concerns as a guiding principle and purpose of the New York city construction codes.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Including environmental concerns as a guiding principle and purpose of the New York city construction codes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to lighting of temporary walkways, foot bridges and sidewalk sheds at construction sites.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Lighting of temporary walkways, foot bridges and sidewalk sheds at construction sites.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to improving lighting efficiency in dwellings and repealing sections 27-2038 and 27-2039 of such code in relation thereto.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Improving lighting efficiency in dwellings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass and President Obama to sign the Development, Relief, and Education for Alien Minors Act of 2009 (the “DREAM Act”) in order to provide immigration relief to undocumented immigrant students pursuing higher education and to undocumented immigrants who serve in the armed forces.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 3 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Halloran, Ignizio, and Oddo.

The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item: Council Member Vallone, Jr..

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass and President Obama to sign the Development, Relief, and Education for Alien Minors Act of 2009 (the “DREAM Act”).

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to greenhouses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: In relation to greenhouses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to require that all contractors hired by the Authority are certified by the Society for Protective Coating in the appropriate standards for lead abatement.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: MTA to require that all contractors hired by the Authority are certified by the Society for Protective Coating in the appropriate standards for lead abatement.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on all New Yorkers to support the One Nation Working Together movement and to participate in its march in Washington, DC on October 2, 2010.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: New Yorkers to support the One Nation Working Together movement and to participate in its march in Washington, DC on 10/2/10.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to adoption by the city of New York of the international green building code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Adoption by the city of NY of the international green building code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to sun control devices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Sun control devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to allowing large solar rooftop installations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Allowing large solar rooftop installations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to the installation of rooftop solar panels.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Installation of rooftop solar panels.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the New York city energy conservation code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Amending the New York city energy conservation code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regulating the use of mobile telephones while operating non-motorized transportation devices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Regulating the use of mobile telephones while operating non-motorized transportation devices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to displaying a bill of rights and responsibilities in pedicabs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Displaying a bill of rights and responsibilities in pedicabs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the installation of solar power energy systems on building walls and for ground mounted systems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Installation of solar power energy systems on building walls and for ground mounted systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to roof coating standards.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Roof coating standards.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the Administrative Code of the City of New York to require the Department of Buildings to develop and, where appropriate, adopt existing detailed criteria for the installation of vegetated green roofs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Require the Dept of Buildings to develop and, where appropriate, adopt existing detailed criteria for the installation of vegetated green roofs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring photovoltaic installations on city-owned buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring photovoltaic installations on city-owned buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to adoption of standards and a protocol that accommodates the installation of wind energy turbines on buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Adoption of standards and a protocol that accommodates the installation of wind energy turbines on buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York in relation to the installation of city-owned solar hot water systems on city-owned buildings, for privately-owned systems, and to establish a pilot program for owners of private property to install solar hot water systems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Installation of city-owned solar hot water systems on city-owned buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fees for the installation of solar power energy systems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Fees for the installation of solar power energy systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to creation of a Solar Map, accessible online, and to establish a Smart Solar program to help residents and businesses pursue the best solar solution for their locale.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Creation of a Solar Map, accessible online, and to establish a Smart Solar program to help residents and businesses pursue the best solar solution for their locale.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Delaware River Basin Commission to refrain from issuing regulations governing gas exploration and production using hydraulic fracturing and for water withdrawal for the purpose of hydraulic fracturing within the Delaware River Basin until a cumulative impact study is completed to assess the risks and inform the development of adequate regulations for hydraulic fracturing in the Delaware River Basin.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Delaware River Basin Commission to refrain from issuing regulations governing gas exploration and production using hydraulic fracturing and for water withdrawal for the purpose of hydraulic fracturing within the Delaware River Basin.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide data regarding student discharges.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to provide data regarding student discharges.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to mandating bullet-resistant barriers and necessary security inside bank buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Mandating bullet-resistant barriers and necessary security inside bank buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allocation of bus stops to private bus companies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allocation of bus stops to private bus companies.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Public Service Commission to immediately set a competitive electrical rate at the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal in order to facilitate the use of shore-based electrical power by cruise ships that wish to cease idling in ports and reduce the amount of emissions released into the surrounding neighborhoods.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: NYS Public Service Commission to immediately set a competitive electrical rate at the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt and the Governor to sign legislation A.5851/S.4637, which relates to the repeal of the tax exemption for residual petroleum products sold by a business registered as a residual petroleum business to a consumer for exclusive use as a bunker fuel for vessels, or for use by the residual petroleum business as bunker fuel for its own vessels.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Repeal of the tax exemption for residual petroleum products sold by a business registered as a residual petroleum business to a consumer for exclusive use as a bunker fuel for vessels. (A.5851/S.4637)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2011 and Fiscal 2010 Expense Budgets.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2011 and Fiscal 2010 Expense Budgets.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to combined heat and power systems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Exempting solar panels from limits on rooftop coverage.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to, requiring the New York city police department to provide certain security measures for nonpublic schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD to provide certain security measures for nonpublic schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of meats contained within modified atmosphere packaging systems.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Sale of meats contained within modified atmosphere packaging systems.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the use of fur by all clothing manufacturers and the inhumane manner in which the animals used for fur are killed.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the use of fur by all clothing manufacturers and the inhumane manner in which the animals used for fur are killed.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Use of green technologies in landmarked buildings.

Items.Title: Application no. 20105650 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of 7th Avenue Restaurant Group LLC, d/b/a Veranda, to continue to  maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 130 Seventh Avenue South, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.

Items.Title:
By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or Section 20-225 (g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 130 7th Avenue, Community Board 2, Application 20105650 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café, 130 7th Ave, Manhattan (20105650 TCM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Comrie
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 100274 PPM, a disposition, and C 100275 PQM, am acquisition, shall be subject to Council review.  These applications are related to application no. C 100277 ZMM, that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, City Planning (C100274PPM and C100275PQM)

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Editor's Note: There is presently one vacancy in the Council (28th Council District, Queens).
